PURCHASING PROCEDURES
When Purchase Orders Must be Used
Except for items costing less than $10 (which may be purchased
by the use of Petty Cash), Purchase Orders are required for every¬
thing except rent, salaries, tax payments, insurance, utilities, and
travel (see Travel Regulations for information about Travel Authori¬
zation Forms).
Authorization Required
Petty Cash purchases — Purchases of less than $10 where
payment by check is not practical may be reimbursed from Petty Cash
The regular Petty Cash slip will be used and must be authorized by
an appropriate member of the Administrative staff (See Ad:n. Staff
list.)
Purchases of less than $50 — must be authorized by an appropriate
member of the Administrative Staff.
Purchases of $50 to $500 — must be authorized by the appropriate
Division Executive Director, or, in the case of General Administration,
by an officer of the Corporation.
Purchases of $500 or more — must be authorized by the appro¬
priate Division Executive Director(s) and an ificer of the Corpora¬
tion, or, in the case of General Administration, by two officers of
the Corporation.
Procedures - General Office Supplies
General Administration will maintain an inventory of all office
supplies except imprinted papers. The purchase of these supplies,
and the maintenance of an adequate inventory, will be under the
supervision of the Secretary to the President. Persons wishing to
draw supplies will fill out a ’'General Supplies Requisition Slip,”
and present it to the receptionist or the Secretary to the President
in order to obtain supplies. The requisition slips will then be
transmitted by the Secretary to the President to the Accounting
Office so that the supplies may be charged to the appropriate bucket.
Imprinted papers will be handled as a separate item and subject to
regular purchasing procedures.
Procedures - Other than Office Supplies
The following steps will be followed:
1. A ’’Purchase Requisition” will be prepared in duplicate by
the originating office with the proper authorization as indicated in
the "Authorization Required" paragraph above. For items costing
$25 or more, the originating office must obtain at least two price
quotations and explain selection of supplier. This information
must be attached to the original copy of ’’Purchase Requisition” and
forwarded to the Accounting Office. The duplicate will be retained
in the originating office.
